page.title: 05The Local Police
page.content: To become a member of the police force you have to train for two years. To join the South Wales police force you train for ten weeks at Cwmbran and three weeks in Bridgend.At the end of every six months you sit an exam.When qualified you work eight hours every day operating a shift system.In an average size police station there are about one hundred police officers, five of these being policewomen. Some policemen will drive vehicles and some will handle dogs.The most popular breed of dog used is alsatian.These dogs are trained in Bridgend.Most police forces use computers to help them in their fight against crime.Policemen always carry a truncheon, handcuffs, a radio and a breathalyser kit.
